org.jetel.component.aggregate

Class AggregateFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.component.aggregate.AggregateFunction
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Avg, Count, CountNonNull, CountUnique, CRC32, First, FirstNonNull, Last, LastNonNull, Max, MD5, Median, MessageDigestFunction, Min, Modus, StdDev, Sum

    public abstract class AggregateFunction
extends java.lang.Object
    Function that can be used in aggregation.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public abstract java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        name of the aggregation function; every function must have a unique name. This name (case-insensitive) is used in the function mapping of the aggregate component.

      • init

        public abstract void init()
        Initialization of the aggregation function.

      • clear

        public abstract void clear()
        Re-initialize for use in another aggregation group. Used with sorted input, where it's not neccessary to create new instances of aggregation functions.

      • update

        public abstract void update(DataRecord record)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Update results with a record.
        Parameters:
        record -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - error occured during update.

      • storeResult

        public abstract void storeResult(DataField outputField)
        Store the result.
        Parameters:
        outputField - field for storing the result.

      • requiresInputField

        public abstract boolean requiresInputField()
        Returns:
        true if the aggregation function requires an input field as a parameter.

      • checkInputFieldType

        public abstract void checkInputFieldType(DataFieldMetadata inputField)
                                  throws AggregationException
        Checks the compatibility of the type of an input field.
        Parameters:
        inputField -
        Throws:
        AggregationException - if the input field type has incopatible type; the exception message should contain a description of the incompatibility (e.g. "must be Numeric").

      • checkOutputFieldType

        public abstract void checkOutputFieldType(DataFieldMetadata outputField)
                                   throws AggregationException
        Checks the compatibility of the type of an output field.
        Parameters:
        outputField -
        Throws:
        AggregationException - if the output field type has incopatible type; the exception message should contain a description of the incompatibility (e.g. "must be Numeric").
